intro: Ragala ucuquirana-branca, commonly known as the white ucuquirana, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. The plant is often found growing in shaded, moist environments along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth. Its flowers emit a mild fragrance, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
